column5: This a little different scenario as I recently sent a crew on assignment to Trident Lake with Nakina North Outfitters.Trident is a widening of the Esnagami River which is known to have great brook trout fishing and as it turns out they caught lots, both upstream and down from the lake. Trident itself as well as adjacent Marr Lake were pretty well loaded with walleye and pike. No giants but very good numbers.It's a pretty entertaining report with a good number of photos and several videos including a camp tour.Check it out, if you're a trout guy you'll find it interesting I'm sure. Cheers, Mikehttp://www.canadafishingguide.net/tr...trout-bonanza/

I have looked at this place. I love walleye fishing and i am an avid fly fishermen as well and love trout fishing as well as everything else you can catch on the fly. Would love to make this trip some year.

Nice job by Chris and crew. I need to go fishing with these guys ðŸ˜Ž. Although the rest of the guys are Canadian, my brother lives in St. Catherines and I drink Canadian so that makes me pretty much Canadian, eh ? Look forward to more trip reports this year. PjShorthorn.
You're in pjshorthorn! Trident is a pretty unique little gem of a camp. We had a blast.

I think a good fly fisherman would love this camp, the river is perfect for it!Quote: Originally Posted by pjshorthornNice job by Chris and crew. I need to go fishing with these guys ðŸ˜Ž. Look forward to more trip reports this year.PjShorthorn. Pat your brother lives in St. Kitt's? That's very close to me. If you ever come for a visit we'll have to get together for a pint.

He lives about two blocks away from the marina in town. If I had only known that was your stomping grounds we could have hooked up last summer when I was there for his wedding,but now I know !!!. PjShorthorn.
